titleStmt.title: Pappe with an hatchet Alias, a figge for my God sonne. Or cracke me this nut. Or a countrie cuffe, that is, a sound boxe of the eare, for the idiot Martin to hold his peace, seeing the patch will take no warning. VVritten by one that dares call a dog, a dog, and made to preuent Martins dog daies.
titleStmt.author: Lyly, John, 1554?-1606.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Iohn Anoke, and Iohn Astile [i.e. T. Orwin], for the Bayliue of Withernam, cum priuilegio perennitatis, and are to bee sold at the signe of the crab tree cudgell in thwack-coate lane,

notesStmt.note: A tract in the Marprelate controversy.
The imprint is false; actual imprint from STC.
In this edition, B2v line 26 has "abusde."; D4v lines 11-12 have "next #5FD\ booke, shall be".
Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library.
